page.title: 14SHOPPING
page.content: There are no shops on Canna. Islanders are dependant upon the mainland for most of their requirements. Mallaig is our main source of goods. Groceries are usually ordered by post or telephone to one of the local shops, as are items from the chemist or off-licence. These are then delivered by the ferry. All goods brought on the ferry are subject to carriage charges, thus raising housekeeping costs. Mail order facilities are used for non_perishable commodities such as clothes, furniture, household goods etc. Some of the larger mail order catalogues do not charge sea freight for sending goods to the island, but most of the larger items of household equipment have to be paid for.
